verses.roman:
āpane vasiyā mājhe, āpanāra hāte
tṛṇa, kāṅkara, kuṭā lāgilā kuḍāite

synonyms: āpane—personally; vasiyā mājhe—sitting in the middle; āpanāra hāte—with His own hand; tṛṇa—straw; kāṅkara—grains of sand; kuṭā—dirt; lāgilā—began; kuḍāite—to pick up.
translation: The Lord then personally sat down in the middle and picked up all kinds of straw, grains of sand and dirty things.
